fields.name: db
fields.description: Database name where to insert documents.

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Collection name where to insert documents.

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Delete documents which matching specified filter.
A filter can simply be key, value where key
is the field name and value would be the value for this field. Or a filter can be logical where
two or more fields can be logically joined using $or and $and. A few examples of filter:
<li> To delete a user document where the id has a value 1: ```{"id": 1 }```
<li> To delete all the user documents where the key "id" has a value 1 or 2 or 3: `{"$or": [{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}, {"id": 3}]}`

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Has metadata related to the documents stored.

fields.name: status
fields.description: an enum with value set as "deleted"

fields.name: db
fields.description: Name of the database.

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Name of the collection.

fields.name: options
fields.description: Collection options.

messages.name: DescribeDatabaseResponse
messages.description:
A detailed description about the database and all associated collections.
Description of the collection includes schema details as well.

fields.name: db
fields.description: Name of the database.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata about the database.

fields.name: collections
fields.description:
A detailed description about all the collections.
The description returns collection metadata and the schema.

Drop database with this name. **Note**: Deletes all the collections in the database.

fields.name: databases

fields.label: repeated

fields.name: db
fields.description: Database name to read documents from.

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Collection name to read documents from.

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Returns documents matching this filter.
A filter can simply be key, value where key
is the field name and value would be the value for this field. Or a filter can be logical where
two or more fields can be logically joined using $or and $and. A few examples of filter:
<li> To read a user document where the id has a value 1: ```{"id": 1 }```
<li> To read all the user documents where the key "id" has a value 1 or 2 or 3: `{"$or": [{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}, {"id": 3}]}`

fields.name: fields
fields.description: To read specific fields from a document. Default is all.

fields.name: options
fields.description:
Options that can be used to modify the results, for example "limit" to control the number of documents
returned by the server.

messages.name: ReadRequestOptions
messages.description:
Options that can be used to modify the results, for example "limit" to control the number of documents
returned by the server.

fields.name: tx_ctx
fields.description: Perform operation in the context of this transaction.

fields.name: limit
fields.description: Limit the number of documents returned by the read operation.

fields.name: skip
fields.description: Number of documents to skip before starting to return resulting documents.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination. The next streams will return documents after this offset.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Object containing the collection document.

fields.name: resume_token
fields.description: An internal key, used for pagination.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Has metadata related to the documents stored.

fields.name: db
fields.description: Database name where to replace documents.

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Collection name where to replace documents.

fields.name: documents
fields.description: Array of documents to be replaced. Each document is a JSON object.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Has metadata related to the documents stored.

fields.name: status
fields.description: an enum with value set as "replaced"

messages.name: ResponseMetadata
messages.description: Has metadata related to the documents stored.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Time at which the document was inserted/replaced. Measured in nano-seconds since the Unix epoch.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: Time at which the document was updated. Measured in nano-seconds since the Unix epoch.

messages.name: RollbackTransactionRequest
messages.description: Rollback transaction with the given ID

fields.name: db
fields.description: Database name this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: tx_ctx
fields.description: Tigris transactional context with details about the transactions.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of rollback transaction operation.

messages.name: TransactionCtx
messages.description:
Contains ID which uniquely identifies transaction
This context is returned by BeginTransaction request and
should be passed in the subsequent requests in order to run
them in the context of the same transaction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique for a single transactional request.

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Serves as an internal identifier.

messages.name: TransactionOptions
messages.description: Options that can be used to modify the transaction semantics.

fields.name: db
fields.description: Database name where to update documents

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Collection name where to update documents

fields.name: fields
fields.description:
Fields contains set of fields
with the values which need to be updated.
Should be proper JSON object.

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Update documents which matching specified filter.
A filter can simply be key, value where key
is the field name and value would be the value for this field. Or a filter can be logical where
two or more fields can be logically joined using $or and $and. A few examples of filter:
<li> To update a user document where the id has a value 1: ```{"id": 1 }```
<li> To update all the user documents where the key "id" has a value 1 or 2 or 3: `{"$or": [{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}, {"id": 3}]}`

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Has metadata related to the documents stored.

fields.name: modified_count
fields.description: Returns the number of documents modified.

fields.name: status
fields.description: an enum with value set as "updated".

messages.name: WriteOptions
messages.description: Additional options to modify write requests.

fields.name: tx_ctx
fields.description: Perform operation in the context of this transaction.

methods.name: BeginTransaction
methods.description:
Starts a new transaction and returns a transactional object. All reads/writes performed
within a transaction will run with serializable isolation.

methods.name: CommitTransaction
methods.description:
Atomically commit all the changes performed in the context of the transaction. Commit provides all
or nothing semantics by ensuring no partial updates are in the database due to a transaction failure.

methods.name: RollbackTransaction
methods.description:
Rollback transaction discards all the changes
performed in the transaction

methods.name: Insert
methods.description:
Inserts new documents in the collection and returns an AlreadyExists error if any of the documents
in the request already exists. Insert provides idempotency by returning an error if the document
already exists. To replace documents, use REPLACE API instead of INSERT.

methods.name: Replace
methods.description: Inserts the documents or replaces the existing documents in the collections.

methods.name: Delete
methods.description: Delete a range of documents in the collection using the condition provided in the filter.

methods.name: Update
methods.description: Update a range of documents in the collection using the condition provided in the filter.

methods.name: Read
methods.description: Reads range of documents from the collection using the condition in the filter.

methods.name: CreateOrUpdateCollection
methods.description:
Creates a new collection or atomically upgrades the collection to the new schema changes in the database
passed in the request.

methods.name: DropCollection
methods.description: Drop the collection and all its documents in the database passed in the request.

methods.name: ListCollections
methods.description: List all collections in the database passed in the request.

methods.name: CreateDatabase
methods.description: Creates a new database and returns a AlreadyExists error if the database already exists.

methods.name: DropDatabase
methods.description: Drop database deletes all the collections in the database along with all it documents.

methods.name: DescribeDatabase
methods.description:
Describe database describes the information related to database along
with all the collections inside database.

methods.name: DescribeCollection
methods.description: Describe collection describes the information related to collection.

methods.name: Stream
methods.description:
Provides real time events for the changes made into the database. Streams by default publish all events for a database
but can be restricted to a specific collection. These events can be useful to build event-driven applications.

methods.name: GetInfo
methods.description: Provides the information about the server. This information includes returning the server version, etc.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
